N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 461.6 - Adjournment of hearing

State Regulations
(a) A
party requesting an adjournment must establish good cause for the request. The
administrative law judge may, on the judge's own motion and for good cause, adjourn the hearing. Whenever a judge determines that a hearing is to be
adjourned, the judge shall set forth on the record what constitutes the reason
and the good cause for the adjournment. When adjournments are granted, the case
shall be rescheduled on an expedited basis. (b) The notice of adjourned hearing shall be
in conformity with the provisions of section
461.3
of this Part. Upon an
adjournment for failure of one or more parties to appear, the notice of
adjourned hearing shall state that upon default of such party at the adjourned
hearing, the case may be closed and a decision rendered as the circumstances
warrant. Notes
